intro: Gagea pseudominutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered gagea, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and is native to the western United States. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, rounded bulbs. Gagea pseudominutiflora is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial shade.
